item.title: Public Secure
item.description: Understanding establishing context Stakeholder insight 13 stakeholders were interviewed, whom were all members of different program areas that have the potential to implement a better single sign-on system. Key takeaways from analyzing the existing user flows: login frustrations stem from confusing onboarding processes and a lack of hierarchy in the presentation of information.

item.title: Collective
item.description: Problem Discovery finding a door to open To begin learning what questions to ask, we started by breaking down the challenge prompt: While we looked at other subspaces involving the inclusion of groups with disabilities, we eventually decided on exploring the barriers to inclusion for those with mental health disabilities. Due to the nature of the project being part of a product design sprint, a lack of quantitative results for this project was replaced by reflection on the application’s potential to lower barriers to inclusion via it’s features.
